Nagisa: The main student of the anime who can read the environment of the scene. The viewers (us) are mostly in his point of view.


Karasuma and Karma: Not much to say about them (to avoid spoilers). But let's just say, they are both badasses in their own way.


Irina: That hot substitute teacher if you guys were wondering.....


Enjoyment: 9


I really enjoyed the experience that Assassination Classroom give out. It is full of actions, plot-twists (especially when Koro-Sensei is involve), comedy, badass, and suspenseful. There are times when Koro-Sensei teach the students (and us perhaps) something that they and I never thought or experience before. There are also times when Koro-Sensei is not as always the best, or as perfect than I presumed. In general, the anime gives me and viewers a fair share of laughter and motivation (and maybe some traits of being a badass).


Overall: 9


Assassination Classroom is really cool, funny badass for a classroom setting. I recommend anyone who likes to see epic moments and take part of being a student (in the viewer's perspective of course). Though this is my first review  and I watched subs only; I still think it is worth watching. So watch it as you can get to experience how great of a teacher Koro-Sensei is and the potentials that class 3-E has.

When one reads a summary as ridiculous as the one that Ansatsu Kyoushitsu has, you know it's either going to be brilliant or awful. For me it didn't fall squarely into either, but definitely encompassed more of the former.
For an anime that has 'Assassination' in its name, the anime actually touches really little on actual assassination- the so-called tips that are given the students here and there are more general life tips on growing up, and there was very little real action- this is the reason why I'm not giving AK a higher score. AK, save for one or two scenes involving our protag Nagisaand his good buddy Karma, is sorely lacking in the kind of thrilling battle scenes that would give it an extra edge. It's a pity, too, because while the fight scenes involving each of these characters literally lasted less than a minute, they were more than enough to get me all hyped- and given how bloodshed and gore is pretty much omnipotent in anime nowadays, that should clue you in into the potential that AK had! (Fingers crossed for the second season, though)


By the second or third episode I was privately thinking that AK parallels Great Teacher Onizuka A LOT- an observation I see some others here have made. AK does all the feels right without being overly cliche or mushy about it- lessons imparted and character development are 10/10. Karma is the kind of crazy kid that half of fandom will swoon over, and Nagisa goes from being curiously androgynous to actually being...cool. Who would've thought.


Tangentially, I should note that since the class' goal is technically to kill their teacher, AK is full of the kind of dark humour that I'm totally down for, but might not be others' cup of tea. That aside, the supposed 'antagonist' or so called indomitable teacher is a right goofball so you'll get plenty of laughs from him as well. There's also the inevitable bikini humour/dash of big boobs which I abhor but have been resigned to accepting as a characteristic of modern anime, though thankfully that's kept to a minimum.


tl;dr had great fun with AK these two days and looking forward to a second season; if you're looking for a non-romantic/coming of age comedy to indulge in this is for you!

This anime ended up being something far different from what I thought it would be about from it's title, yet, I wasn't disappointed at all. I'm a sucker for anime that teach you life lessons and are in some ways inspiring in the sense of bettering yourself as a person. I certainly didn't expect to get that from this anime. The supposed bad guy in this anime is the yellow octopus creature who is the teacher of a classroom of misfits whose objective is to assassinate said bad guy. Yet, from all the episodes, he really doesn't seem like a bad guy. In fact, toa certain extent you start feeling like you don;t want him to be assassinated at all because he's such an awesome octopus.\n\n
This first season is all about introducing the important characters of the series. It explores their personalities and what they excel at, so that we can get connections and chemistry with these characters. No doubt so that later on we feel it when something tragic happens. This anime is also light-humored so you will get some little laughs in as it progresses. It doesn't try too hard to be good so I really like this anime, so I give it an overall 9.

Another anime from the Shonen Jump magazine ( they always turn out to be great).
This anime is great overall. It has good storyline with a good mix of humour. Although the story seems to have a light feel to it, it sometimes is deep enough to give valuable life messages. It shows different teaching styles and  how students can grow under those teachings.
Even though the students of E class are the worst in the whole school, they all have their own personalities and talents. And their teacher is the best of all.
The best part of the anime is how the students go about tryingto assassinate their homeroom teacher (octopus??) while still taking classes from him. There is great story and character development and not even one episode is boring. Even if you are new to the anime world....watch it....and you'll not regret it.

I...yea...how to say...
So you know, i saw this picture of a class pointing their guns at this weird looking teacher. So i went off and watched it, because.. who would not like to kill their teacher at some point?
I actually expected it to be...different...like...yea...a class being trained in assassination, but for other purpose... 
What i got was something weird. I fell in love with Koro-sensei the moment he first talked and what he delivered was...different! In a hilarious way. I pressed the entire anime into two nights. 
It's very very funny and in the end you ask yourself "Why so serious? ... Oh, because earthis getting blown up? I don't care, Koro-sensei is awesome!"\n\n
So everyone, keep calm and kill your teacher!\n\n
CHEERS!

Ansatsu Kyoushitsu, or Assassination Classroom, is an Anime Series about an alien that becomes a teacher to a classroom of misfits. Yes, I know it sounds weird, but the alien (Known by Koro-Sensei or Unkillable-Teacher) is a surprisingly good plot point. The children, are given weapons, and must destroy/kill the teacher. The reason for this, is that he claims to have blown up the moon. The setup is pretty interesting. The characters all feel unique, and it's quite honestly one of the most humorous shows I've seen of all time. For instance, Episode 8 starts out with this "Korosensei" singing a song of how tomake his face on earth (Including dropping a giant bean in Tokyo and flying at Mach 20 across the sky). This humor also brings the series along quite well, and it's quite funny at times. There are some tense and serious moments, especially towards the end, but it was overall one of the best anime I've seen in a while.

the story is very very unique a crazy one too. an unthinkable story before. the class have to kill their classroom teacher?? and the teacher is very quick?! plusss it's a monster! an octopus! oh please... where did you get the idea sensei. but, he is very kind, a perfect kind of teacher. an ideal teacher i would say. i must say this anime is the top one. comedy.. action.. school life.. romance maybe? and a little bit of ecchi is perfect. but... sometimes the episode is boring. i wouldn't say it's a filler, because it's a little bit useful (?) in the upcoming episode.watch it. you won't regret it. especially if you are a student.

Let me start the review by saying Toka Yada is best girl and her lack of screen time is criminal. Now we have that out of the way lets get started. 
The premise of Assassination Classroom is simple. Asian Dad of the year becomes principal of an elite school and decides to push all the worst students into a special class E. Class E is used by Asian Dads and moms everywhere to scare and motivate their kids to work and study hard. However suddenly the moon gets destroyed and the person(thing?) responsible ends up becoming the teacher for Class E. Class E now getsan additional mission apart from clawing their way out of Class E and that is to assassinate their teacher before end of year else their teacher will destroy the whole world. 


That premise should be enough to convince most of you to watch the show. If for some reason, you arent convinced then its no use. If someone is convinced but want to read on while the video buffers in the background, read on. 


The biggest strength of Assassination Classroom is the teacher, Koro Sensei. He is an Octopus thing who can move at mach 20 speed and is insanely powerful. In a surprising twist, Koro-sensei is also the dream teacher none of us ever had (NOTE: not talking about the sex fetish we all had) He understands his students, takes note of individual abilities, takes time to customize his training for each student and is always available to cheer them up. As the show progresses, Koro-sensei shows incredible enthusiasm as the students' efforts to assassinate him. Apart from Koro-sensei however the rest of the characters are quite weak. The MC is an androgynous male who is as original as a wet tissue. The anime makes an effort to build the characters and make them unique by having them have diverse interests and reasons for coming to class E but they just isnt enough time to build each character up sufficiently. MC for me is weak and I do not think I will ever like him. Season 2 needs more Rio Nakamura, Karma, Toka Yada and Terasaka and less of Nagisa and Kayano. 


The animation is smooth and well done. No compaints there. The music is really good with my favorite being Track 17 called Ritsu. The first OP is catchy. 


In terms of enjoyment, each episode is enjoyable and seeing the students come up with plans to try and take down not only Koro-sensei but the other challenges they face is always fun. Heck, watching Koro-sensei react to things around him for 20 straight mins would be a blast. 


Overall 8/10. Onto season 2.

Yo, Wabbit here and im here for short reviews. Also im a 13 year old so im not gonna be a god at this. (Minor Spoilers) 1st Review!!!
Story/Plot: This was different and weird, but, very enjoyable.

Sound: Fun and upbeat, nice to listen to and when things get serious it has the perfect sounds for it.

Overall: Its a nice break from typical fighting anime. The more you watch the more you get hooked. Learning about the characters was the one thing anime i've watched hasn't done correct.

On my pious quest to find a suitable dub other than Black Lagoon or Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu I stumbled across Ansatsu Kyoushitsu. And quite frankly, I'm glad I did. I started to watch the show subbed but was recommended to switch over after about 3-4 episodes in. I'm glad I decided to finally watch the show, and I'm glad I listened to my colleague on the topic of English voice casting.
~Story~
Assassination Classroom by far is one of the most unique plots in any anime that I have personally watched, (that make sense). The premise isn't special but the array of circumstances is clear, byepisode one you know what the goal of the show is and you know if you're going to love it or hate it.

A squid monster who can move, (and fly) at supersonic mach 20 speeds has destroyed 75% of the moon leaving it a permanent crescent. In one year he states that he will destroy the Earth in it's entirety.  However, he has made a deal with the World's governments after they had failed assassinating him multiple times. This deal is that he teaches a class of 'failure' students and 'rebels' in class E (End Class). The students are equipt to assassinate him with special weapons that will only work on this monster, it will prove a challenge in the episodes to come to defeat this being. The World's government sends in multiple other assassins and 'teachers' doing this series, all prove to fail. In saying this, the show itself is drenched in satirical comedy and hilarious anime references, one of the funniest anime I have ever had the enjoyment of watching.


~Art~

I was personally shocked at the performance of Studio Lerche's amazing work on Ansatsu Kyoushitsu. The variety of colors, the glowing, almost Madhouse looking designs. If Studio Lerche was applying for a job, this would be at the top of their resume.


~Sound~

Any show that has an opening that can get you excited for it's next episode is definitely worth noting. When I think of these some come to mind, Higurashi no naku koro ni and kai, Neon Genesis Evangelion, Full Metal Panic, the list goes on for openings that get me pumped for the show. In no way am I comparing tracks from this show to other shows but rather in a static format, relatable.

Assassination Classroom's first OP, everything from the extreme ADHD art to the sound is amazing, and the ending also takes the cake for one of the most chill endings in anime.

I highly recommend the dub, or switching between sub and dub to see which one you prefer. Remember it's about enjoying the show, not what others think of you personally for choosing to watch a dub. Don't be that guy.


~Character~

What happens when you take 27-28 Jr High students, give them guns, and tell them to fight a squid monster who is going to destroy the Earth in a year?! Have fun.

The character development in Ansatsu Kyoushitsu is astounding and deserves full praise for it's use of a bait and switch tactics with a twist "what the f***?". This squid monster you will find here cares for his students more than anything, and would literally die for them, (ironic). Their well-being and future is on the top of his priority list. Yet, still, he wishes to destroy the Earth by the end of their second term, this is the twist.

We see regular students develop into killers, but they learn in the most ethical and moral ways possible, personally by their teacher.


~Enjoyment~

Assassination Classroom is a fun ride, and I'm definitely getting my hands on season 2!


~Overall~

Buy it, buy it, buy it.

Assassination Classroom is worth your hard earned cash, and since season 2 has a higher overall rating, buy that in advance.

You're in for a good time boys and girls.

Dear reader,
I seriously recommend this anime over SAO. It has about the same episodes in total and if you had to choose one, I would say choose Assassination Classroom.
It was funnier and has many more interesting characters in it. The openings are also better and you are more dragged into this anime by the opening, because the opening is so friendly and happy. 
I really enjoyed the first season of Assassination Classroom and am currently watching the second season. I like the idea of annihilating a teacher, because he says he will destroy the world next March after destroying the moon. This annihilation is notmeant to work with normal weapons, but with special anti-teacher weapons. For example a rubber knife and special anti-teacher bullets.\n\n
I also like the character of Korosensei, because he is perverted, likes sweets stuff and he is not a human. Watch this anime, because there are not that many animes which consist of 50 episodes and are good.

STORY - 7
ART - 9
SOUND - 8
CHARACTER - 7
ENJOYMENT - 8
Assassination Classroom is a weird premise combining that of both students and assassins to deliver a unique story. And to make it even more strange, they were given a task to kill their teacher who is an undefeatable foe... and friend?
This is a lighthearted anime of a bizarre classroom full of bizarre students being taught by a bizarre teacher. Yes, it's a peculiar concept but that alone is what made the anime appealing to me when I first stumbled upon it. The setting of a classroom with the addition of a seemingly immortal octopus-resembling teacherby the name of Koro-sensei turned the familiar place into a zone of assassins. Forging the themes of education and assassination brought in a set of lessons that highlighted some of the many characters. The majority of the students felt like background characters, getting a bit of dialogues occasionally but the ones that got a spotlight spoke volumes about what the show can provide. It's not highly psychological and it fits the story perfectly well, a fun entertainment basically. Koro-sensei is the iconic figure who is well-rounded in terms of his comedic personality and gives his students the best of what he can offer, even though he's a target for them. This made the student-teacher relationship a unique dynamic. Other teachers also comes with their own ideas of education, teaching the students all sorts of things to prepare them for what's to come, both in assassination and the dilemma of being a discriminated class. Speaking about class, what I find lacking was the school part as a bigger aspect of this show. It was shown that the class was prejudiced against but the attempts to show this issue appeared to be contrived or forceful. Simply, the slice-of-life plus assassination aspect was more enjoyable, with the multitude of assassination attempts, interactions and bonds between the characters, and the developments of a small few.\n\n
Another stronger aspect was the visual imagery of this oddly entertaining anime. The art style does take time to get used to, and once you settled in, the colorful gradients with the thick outlines for the characters gave a strong, striking appearance. Maybe because of the fact that the underlying theme was assassination, the art felt like a juxtaposition, a contrasting nature to that of the darkness or redness that you might expect. Not to say that there weren't any of those because it's an assassination anime anyways so it also came with fights too. Lerche portrayed the darker side with the use of sharp dedication in the characters and optical symbolisms such as snakes to represent the killer instincts. In more action-packed scenes, the animation helped in expressing a few things. Such examples would be the camera shakes that came with the unbeatable speed of Koro-sensei, yet again showing his apparent invulnerability. Or the amplified expressions in the characters who faced against the polishing assassination students. For the soundtracks, nothing really stood out though there were instances where they raised the atmosphere of some scenes. The only one that stood out well at first glance was the ending song, Hello, shooting-star. It's warm and soothing to the ears, and the chalkboard art that comes with the ending felt nostalgic to me as a high-schooler.\n\n
School is a place where most of us will go through, and it can be quite stressful at a lot of times even to the most relaxed person out there. Assassination Classroom brings in a fun aura to the well-known classroom setting, having an ambience that is spirit-lifting. There were quite a bit of questions, answers, and improvements that were left in the first season, but overall, it was an anime that nicely incorporated assassination and education in an extraordinary fashion.

As much as I love anime, there are times when I find it absolutely detestable. Not to say this show is bad, but it makes me feel envious, envious that my school days could never be as depicted here and in most other school-based series.
For a lesser-known suidio, Lerche produces one of the better-looking series I've seen recently. The characters are well-drawn and move fluidly. The characters themselves though are mostly lacking in personality, relying on single traits. That is until you get to what I like to call the big four; Nagisa, Karma, Kaede and the big guy himself, Koro-sensei.
The soundtrack is, like theBakemonogatari soundtrack, full of catchy tunes that won't leave your head too soon.\n\n
The cleverest thing this show achieves is its subversion of battle shonen tropes. Big training scenes? Just have our guys and girls studying. The battle scene against rivals? an exam. The rivals/big bads themselves? students from an elite class.\n\n
For all people tired of the usual shonen series, as well as people just looking for a good watch, this is worth a try.

Looking at the good ratings for this show, I had my hopes high for a witty, funny and action packed anime. Unfortunately, it seemed quite a rehash of similar animes in the genre, this time with the premise of an "unkillable" teacher that looks like an octopus. Since I finished the whole show, I must admit that it was quite enjoyable, although I needed to get to terms with one major plot hole.
Which was as follows:
It seems odd that the main characters's only concern is whether they will do well in school or gym, when they are possibly faced with extinction of the whole humanrace. Yes, they "funnily" tiedy to kill their teacher every opportunity they got, and knowing it was futile, they probably gave up on really doing anything to harm the creature. However, the psychological despair that knowing you are the reason earth will get destroyed is never portrayed. Somehow, doing good with your grades is more important than saving earth from destruction. I guess that's part of the "comedy" studio Lerche was trying to portray.\n\n
The most enjoyable part of the show was character development. I did feel somewhat for the individual characters's struggle (not related to killing their teacher though) and how they were overcoming this. It's just disappointing that they were completely oblivious of what the consequences of them not killing their teaching would be. Only a few characters were willing to do what it takes, but those were portrayed as evil. Why worry about earth if you can worry about your grades, right?

This show was... interesting. When I started it, I was expecting something along the lines of the horror anime "Another": a dark classroom setting. I was expecting the chemistry of "Danganronpa": a somewhat gory anime of students having to kill eachtoher for freedom. However, I got neither of these, but I was quite pleased that I didn't. 
This anime doesn't fit the summary, in my opinion, so if you want to turn away because the summary doesn't appeal to you, then I suggest you don't. If you like humor, group missions, fight scenes, battles (whether hand-to-hand or just midterms) and the whole school package, thenI suggest you stick around. The best part of this entire anime is character. 


When I watched the first few episodes, it didn't hold my interest for very long and I was on verge of quitting it, but I have OCD about leaving shows unfinished, so I went back and forced myself to keep watching. However, by the time I watched episode 12, I wasn't forcing myself anymore: I was truly enjoying it. 


The selling point for this anime is the characters. They have great chemistry and it's great to watch them interact, not to mention the fact that they're all really skilled but also flawed, so you can cheer them on like real people. Sometimes it takes the cliche side of things, but I can assure you that there'll be some surprises. Some characters may blend into the background, but the ones upfront will never let your attention waver. 


There's humor, enough action to keep me from getting bored, a little hint of romance thrown in for romance addicts like me (if you don't like romance, don't worry about it, it barely even lasts for ten seconds in the first season), some great teamwork and characters, and a good plot line with not too many holes. If you're looking for something to watch casually, this could be your next show.

School drama, plot to save the world, assassins, what more could you ask for in an anime. 
Assassination Classroom is a unique combination of several genres under the guise of a goofy, cheery school life anime. 
The anime’s story is pretty fun to watch as it evolves over the 2 seasons. We are watching the students grow as people, but we also see them grow as assassins as they learn of how to possibly kill their teacher at any open chance they get. It’s a great mix between very well directed action scenes/animation and typical high school activities and issues the students deal with overthe course of a year. At around 50 episodes over 2 seasons, the pacing works well, although there are a few filler episodes, they all leave you feeling good at the end. It’s enthralling and captivating but at the same time a pure joy of a watch. 


The characters, besides the teacher, consists of all the students in the class and a teaching assistant provided by the government to teach the kids how to be assassins.  Although there are around 20 or so students, the anime does a good job of giving them all unique personalities and making it easy to distinguish between them. They also work together to almost seem like one big character. They grow personally and as a class and school anime’s don’t get better than this. 


There are a few standouts in the class and they help propel the plot and bring in some of the most climactic and thrilling episodes. They all become characters you stand behind and want to succeed, you even end up liking Koro-Sensei despite the fact he plans on destroying the world. 


The art is bright and fits the setting and mood well. There are darker moments and the art definitely helps to amplify it. The animation is sharp and spot on, it all feels clean and pristine from front to back. 


The voice acting in the subbed version is great and the soundtrack to the show is amazing as well. 


Assassination Classroom is a complete package that doesn’t drag along and doesn’t feel like a chore to watch. It’s an amazing story and written and directed superbly. I consider this a must watch and one that you won’t regret once you start.

As a student struggling about school,I have really felt the side of the story. I have this mixed reaction with school throughout my life.80% concept of education’s system is what I can relate to.There were times where I have to face scary,strict,demanding and mood swing teachers living my life like hell. But in this case of the story,I have find the teacher(main character) phenomenal and extraordinary. Nurufufufufu .You may heard this sound in every episode.

There are many reasons why I enjoyed this series, and being able to watch it with my 9-year-old daughter with both of us having a good time is at the top of the list. There are not many series that provide that, since they are either not appropriate for kids that age or they are boring for an adult like me. This is one of those rare exceptions.
If I told you that the basic premise of the series is that a classroom of students are "assigned" with the task to kill their teacher, who is an alien that promised to destroy the earth by theend of the school year if the class does not achieve the objective, you would think that this is an action anime. This is far from the truth. This series is much more about the relationship between a teacher that really cares for his students' development and personal growth, and about findings success when the odds are stacked against you. 


There is quite a bit of humor in this series, some of it is high quality, some of it a little silly (it's a shonen after all, what do you expect?). The art is good without being the best out there. But the other area in which this series shines is in its characters. They dis a really great job with providing us with various options from students in the class that get the spotlight shined on them. That way, each one of us can have his / her favorite. From the quiet and cerebral Nagisa, to the Machiavellian Karma, to the bully Ryouma, there are plenty of options to choose from. On top of that, there are some intriguing characters as teachers.


Overall, this is a fun series to watch. It may not be the highest quality anime out there, but if you are looking for some pure unadulterated fun, you should look no further. And as I mentioned at the start, if you are looking for a show to watch as a family, this is it!

Story: 8/10 
The plot is simple and very easy to follow, but there’s never a dull moment. The theme could have been dark and dreary (a point gracefully pointed out in the first opening song), but it’s instead lighthearted and funny, which is a huge advantage for plot progression. The story manages to advance and remain mostly comedic, which makes sitting down and watching it feel neither like a chore nor like a total emersion in brain cell destruction. Lastly, it is inarguably an incredibly original idea that I have yet seen to be attempted by any other series—HOWEVER, I will say that if you’relooking for anything down-to-earth or serious, this doesn’t fit the bill (unless you’re willing to suffer through a good 19 episodes of comedy). Really, if you start to think too much, you also start to realize how weird even the semi-dramatic scenes (and full-blown dramatic ones that appear later in the series) are, and it takes you out of the moment.\n
Art: 9/10\n
The art style closely resembles that of Attack on Titan, with thick outlines, distinctive eye styles, various nose shapes, and assorted hair types (with, admittedly, many more unrealistic yet anime-esque colors of hair that help to reflect the difference in genre between the two series). \n
Note: [Upon a bit of further research, I found out that, in conflict with my prediction, the two were animation through completely different studios—Wit Studio (AoT) and Lerche (AC)] \n
Character: 10/10	\n
The character development, to my surprise, is taken pretty seriously.  Even Koro-sensei, who is meant to be the most mysterious character, has specific personality traits and weaknesses easily discovered by Nagisa’s diligent note-taking.\n
Sound: 8/10\n
I give the sound 8/10. I actually picked up on the OST this time, realizing that I would have to include it in this review—but considering that this series was given 22 episodes instead of your average 12, it was neither extremely notable nor really bad. I suppose I couldn’t expect it to have an exceptional soundtrack given that it’s a comedy anime--but I think it could’ve been better, because though certain sounds did reoccur, there was no characteristic background music, just generic music.  I will say that I appreciated the difference between the opening of the first 11 episodes and the last 11.\n
Enjoyment: 9/10\n
As I mentioned above, it is a pretty light-hearted series, and there wasn’t a point where I got bored of watching. That being said, given that this was mainly comedic anime, while there were times I did laugh, it wasn’t frequently, which is what separates this anime from one I would give a perfect score.\n
Overall: 9/10\n
Would watch again. Looking forward to Season 2.\n

Ansatsu Kyoushitsu also called assassination classroom in english Its basically an a group of assassins are given a mission to kill their teacher Koro-sensei who is a supernatural being (alien) who can move really fast and was strong enough to make the moon in his own image and class-E aka the assassination classroom are given the task to kill him before they graduate or Koro-sensei will cause more harm and whatnot. My overall experience with the anime was good i watched the dub and thought the voice actor for Koro-sensei did a really damn good job the voice for karma and so on the musicwas decent nothing too special. The intro however was really catchy every time i think about the anime the introduction music just comes into mind. The art is pretty good as well pretty decent character designs nothing too amazing but im not the artist so i cannot say garbage about it. Animation was good, story was fun and interesting enough to get me invested and to actually share a little laugh. Characters were pretty good the anime is more so focused on the class itself rather than 1 main character overall i just really enjoyed this anime and id recommend it.

Assassination Classroom is pretty good.
Quite a number of characters had development whether through an entire episode or through scenes spread out over the course of the anime. The supposed main character isn't very main and screen time is distributed, making the story a lot more about the class as a whole instead of following a small group to carry the plot. Actually, I suppose Koro Sensei is the main character in that he appears in practically every scene.
Mmmm... I'm not entirely sure why it was interesting to watch though... Makes you wonder what surprises will happen next I suppose. Or rather, it makes you wantto see what happens and how the characters come into play.\n\n
A few nitpicks I suppose: Even when suspending disbelief about the basically invincible being that can do almost whatever the plot requires, travelling at whatever speed he's using in the classroom should cause papers and hair to fly, which bothered me for about 12 episodes before letting it go. It does make an effort to make ridiculous feats believable though. Also, If the moon were to have part of it blown up, it will not remain crescent. Also unresolved plot lines.\n\n
Overal, it was fun. 7/10

At school, you may have some boring teachers, and you may sleep through their lessons; then, you may also have some teachers you actually like, and you're actually engaged in their lessons. For example, the teacher for assassination class is - Wait, assassination?! Since when does a school teach their students about assassination?! Well, if you're in Class 3-E of Kunugigaoka Junior High School, you would know the answer to that question. I don't remember exactly when it was that I first found out about Assassination Classroom, nor do I remember when was it that I decided that I was going to watch it; allI can say is that it was very enjoyable.


Ladies and gentlemen, tentacles all over, here is my review for Assassination Classroom.


Assassination Classroom begins with a large portion of the moon being destroyed, turning it into a permanent crescent. (That's right, folks, full moons are now a thing of the past!) The one responsible for this catastrophe is a giant, yellow, octopus-like.... thing. Oh, you know how I mentioned what happened to the moon? Yeah, apparently, Earth's next, but first, the octopus thing, eventually named Koro-sensei, wants to teach Class 3-E at Kunugigaoka Junior High for a year! As a result, the students of Class 3-E are given an assignment; they have to assassinate Koro-sensei before graduation, with the prize for doing so being 10 billion yen! Of course, with that big of a bounty on his head, it's obvious that Koro-sensei is no easy target; he can move at Mach 20 speed, which makes it easy for him to dodge all of their attacks. It's not just that that's getting in their way (although Nagisa Shiota does take notes on his weaknesses); it's also how Koro-sensei is the best teacher they have ever had. Much emphasis on ever is used here, considered how badly Class E is normally treated.


Yeah, the story of Assassination Classroom can be quite interesting. It has a bit of a comedy/slice-of-life feel mixed with all of the students' attempts to assassinate their teacher, and it mixes in a bit of the academics, as well. What makes the story of Assassination Classroom interesting, however, is its characters. This anime is full of interesting characters, with not even one dull one. Saying that Koro-sensei is a great teacher is a great understatement; despite how he plots to destroy the Earth the way he did the moon, he puts his students first. He doesn't just teach them school subjects; he teaches them about life and goes above and beyond to help them with their problems. Koro-sensei isn't the only interesting character, though. A majority of the Class E students are likable, especially Karma, Nagisa, Kayano, and Ritsu. If there's any character in this anime I don't like, it's any student besides those in Class E; I just hated how poorly Class E is treated by others. They may be the lowest class, but the LEAST you could do is be at least a LITTLE bit nice to them!


The animation in AssClass (am I the only one who is amused by this abbreviation?), done by Lerche, was very well-done. It really stands out in the action scenes; with the fluid animation in the action scenes, you can really feel yourself getting into it. I alternated between watching this in Japanese (with English subs) and English (dubbed, of course), and I have to say that both versions have good voice acting. I also liked both opening themes, "Seishun Satsubatsu-ron" and "Jiriki Hongan Revolution"; they were very upbeat. While the ending theme, "Hello, shooting star", was also great, sometimes, I didn't feel it didn't really fit this anime.


Overall, Assassination Classroom is a very good anime. If you like anime that focus on teachers trying to teach their students (some other examples being Negima and Denpa Kyoushi), I think I'd automatically recommend this one. There are quite some interesting and funny things happening in the assassination classroom, where the students are assassins and their target is their teacher!

Story: Japanese for Assassination Classroom, we all know the story. An alien apparently blew up the moon somehow, and then he comes to Earth announcing he will destroy it, too. However, he offers the government a challenge. He will teach a class in Japan, and in the process, they can figure out how to kill him, and they have until their graduation to save the planet. The government offers called 3-E one million yen if one of them or all can get the job done. When you see this anime on this site first, you can see that it's a comedy. Based on the plotas a whole, what more would you expect from this show? Though the story is pretty over the top, the plot as a whole is done extremely well. I'm only saying that because everything you would predict does not happen unless you have read the manga before. I did not, so this surprised me on how interesting it really was. 10/10 kudos for the story.


Art: The art is pretty neat for a shonen. It gives Assassination Classroom its own style. Also, I am very surprised on how well they make Koro-sensei while he's moving at the speed of light in the classroom while helping his students. It returns to the classic 2D animation that bring people to watching animation in the first place. With most companies trying to go the 3D animation route, people are forgetting about what you can do with 2D animation. Nothing seems to fail with the animation here. I'm in love with it. 10/10.


Sound: The openings to this show always get me going. They immediately tell you what this show is going to be like, but as soon as you get the endings, it's like a calming down back into reality, which is also done very well. Personally, I'm not a fan of the openings due to I wouldn't listen the shit out of them, but I'm in love with how calm the endings are. The soundtrack inside the anime is pretty good as well. It's simple, but it plays each scene perfectly. 9/10 for this one.


Character: There is actually no character that has been ever misplaced in this show at all. In a show like Assassination Classroom, you would expect only a few of the students to play a major role. That is somewhat the case, but each student does play a part and have his or her own personality to the point that they could be related towards the viewers. Though Koro-sensei is a god character, and we've seen too many of those before, he's a different type of god character. He says that he'll destroy the world, but he doesn't sound like that at all. In fact, he will do anything to protect the students he's teaching. He's like the father these kids never really had, and he would never let anything hurt them. If anything, he teaches them how to become stronger besides learning the ways of the assassins, and that's important for kids in our generation. My two favorite characters have to be Nagisa and Karma. Nagisa is basically the leader without knowing he's the leader. He's not the boring protagonist either. Though he's studious, he actually feels emotion, and we pity him for being in the lowest class because we know he doesn't deserve to be there. Karma is kinda a sociopath, but at the same time, he does care about Nagisa as his best friend. He's cocky, but he learns that cockiness leads to sloppy work. Though he's a jerk, he's a smart, caring jerk, and honestly, he's a sexy beast, and I love him. Even the side characters were done very well (God bless Bitch-sensei). Perfect 10/10.


Enjoyment: This show had to be the funniest show I have ever seen in my entire life. I bet it was funnier in English sub because I watched the broadcast dub version, but the show is still pretty damn good nonetheless. Every episode has at least a handful of good jokes. I also enjoyed watching the characters go on their journeys whether they have the same goals or not. This show just does everything right, and I never thought I would find something like that in forever. 10/10


Overall: For anime fans all around, this show is a must watch. If you don't watch this show, what are you doing with your life? If you're worried that the dub sucks, it actually doesn't. There is no misplaced voice at all. Even Nagisa sounds accurate. Koro-sensei is not annoying sounding, which is a plus. Overall, I'd give this show a rounded up 10/10.

the title itself is honestly catchy but not in the positive way... 
Assassination classroom? What comes to the mind of the viewers? Something like students killing their teacher for some reasons? It sounded like a bad-ass example for youngsters... 
BUT HOLD-UP!! the trend might be that way... Junior high school students (they are only 14-16 y/o!!) were given a grave task to kill their very own homeroom teacher just to save the world and for the price of 10 billion yen!! but the story was beyond that... What made me like this anime (as well as the manga) was how the teacher had motivated hisstudents to fight against the inferiority complex that the school itself had been trying to shove into themselves. It was an amazing feat for a teacher to see soul-deep all of his students and treated them equally like his own kids. Despite the fact of his past life, he had been able  to set the correct path for them and these kids were able follow that path accordingly. The students had surpassed the challenges of being both as assassins and leftover students and at the end, they were able to smile and thank fate for giving them such man who never gave them up and even raised them up from the mud of the society. \n\n
Assassination Classroom is an amazing story which featured how people who once lost their ways might still correct the paths of others to avoid the same mistakes and how students were still able to look back to those memories with smiling face and acknowledgement of the person who understood them more than enough. \n\n
"Whether a fish lives in a clear stream or a water ditch, so long as it is continues swimming forward, it will grow beautifully." -Korosensei-

So Assassination classroom. Definitely a weird concept. I got recommended this series through a friend. His words to describe it was " A class tries to kill their insanely fast octopus teacher." The weirdness alone is what drew me in, and I am glad that I did. So this series is weakest point is definitely the story. However that is not necessarily a bad thing. One piece does not have much of a story either. It focuses on adventure and the characters going through situations. Similar premise here. What drives this anime is the solely character development. Which I love. It is interesting to seethe characters react to the situations presented to them. You really grow found of the characters, and you actually care about them when the great plot twists come into play. Which those twists make complete sense even if they do make you mad and or sad. The story actually does make sense, and from what I can tell no plotholes. The animation is also pretty good as well. Though I have not really watched to many of this studios work. I do love their series they made called Oh! Samurai Girls. They also made Danganronpa if you like that series. Overall this is just a solid series. I LOVE YOU KOROSENSEI!!!
     I enjoy watching the whole first season of Assassination Classroom. Its filled with the fun adventures of the E class. Even though they are belittled by the other classes, they still did their best to beat them. Each episode was started with that catchy opening song, Even now I still remember the tune.
     Seeing how the failing students improve with the skills taught by Korosensei, change my view on teachers(well some of them) I would love to live in their world and be a student of Korosensei's Assassination Classroom. Where the fun begins.I hope that my review helped you in seeing Ansatsu Kyoushitsu in my point of view. Where it changed mt view among our hardworking teachers.

When written out on a piece of paper, the plot to Assassination Classroom sounds like some half-baked plot a kid with anger issues would start out with.  Basing a show around killing a teacher would be very easy to mess up, one slip and you go from the funny into the cruel and disturbed.  Assassination Classroom walks this precipice with a grace that just gets smoother and faster the farther you get into it.  The first episode is rocky, but the show quickly figures out what it wants to do, and it takes it from 0 to 100 real fast.
Every character hasa chance to shine.  My one worry with this anime was that a few characters would be handpicked out, and the rest of the class would be used purely for background movement.  But no, somehow every single person you see is fleshed out to be believable.  And this is all done without any filler episodes, or any sacrifice to the pacing of the plot.


The only minor complaint I have is that the art and music really didnt pop out too much.  The openings were great, and didnt get old, however they werent very deep.  The art style is a typical anime art style, without much deviance from the norm.  However each character was distinct, and no-one looked too far fetched.


All in all I loved Assassination Classroom.  It was just witty enough to get a laugh, just fast enough to never get boring, just enthralling enough to keep me hooked, and all thats piled ontop of a great story, with genuinely likable characters.  I can say Im genuinely exicted to watch Season 2

Assassination Classroom is not fot everyone. Its concept is weird and it kind of makes you question whether you should watch it or not at first. However, once you get used to the concept, it actually becomes pretty balanced.
Story-wise, it's a pretty chill anime that offers you that one bit of relaxation. You don't have to waste brain power to understand what's going on. You don't have to pause it all the time just because you have to read that one line you missed. It's also pretty funny; the humor is simple but effective. There are gags that play many times without getting boring. That'swhat happens at the beginning. After a certain point, Assassination Classroom becomes way more interesting and you'll find yourself invested in it. Action, deep meanings, great humor, anger, you'll feel it all. You can see that there's a big backstory that just hasn't been revealed yet and that makes it all the more great.


Regarding the characters, they're all exceptionally unique. Yuusei Matsui managed to create ~35 different characters that still feel so different from each other. The students' designs (apart from the protagonists) are not too unique, but they aren't bland either. You can distinguish them all easily and you'll also like them all. Their personalities are loveable and fairly realistic. Korosensei himself is a really interesting character, just like the protagonist students and the rest of class E's teachers. The best part about them is that there's an harmony between them. They all have their own quirks and talents and they blend in so well to the point that they make a great team. The character development is fair, some get more, some do not, but it's always enough to make you like them all.


The art and the animation is not really exceptional. It's pretty ok, actually. It doesn't stand out, but it doesn't disappoint or disturb you. On the other side, the music is nice. It fits the anime and it does manage to give you the chills at certain scenes. It just does.


Overall, it's a pretty great anime which you'll enjoy whether you're here for the deep story or the morals or the humor.

You have probably all had a teacher that you've hated. You've despised him or her so much that you've wanted him or her to get out of your way.
But you've probably never thought of actually killing your educator. That is not the case in Ansatsu Kyoushitsuor or Assassination Classroom and this certainly raises interest for the show.
You have reason to believe that such a one-sided story line - as it might seem in the beginning - will start to get boring. But that is not the case! The plot evolves in a way that keeps the viewer interested by adding a lot of new plotelements, let it be new characters, new locations, new plans. It should be especially noted that the story of Assassination Classroom is unique. Just like the students learn from Koro-Sensei, us viewers also profit from the wisdom of the teacher - sometimes without even realising it ourselves.\n
Beautiful art and music support the anime in any possible way. Its music suits the single scenes superbly and creates the desired atmosphere.\n
Character development. Having a class with approximately 30 pupils and an additional part of other characters, one would strongly suggest that developing each character is difficult and will thus be a weak point of the anime. But again, that is not the case. The show manages to involve most of the characters and gives them a valuable development, often accompanied by wise words of Koro-Sensei. It does indeed focus on the main characters but obviously, there has to be some focus on the main cast.\n\n
Assassination Classroom is a show to be loved, a show to be cherished. This and its sequel are must-watch for any anime fan out there.

In this anime there are a lot of characters like over 28. i enjoyed this anime for its humour and action. the first i got the most enjoyment out of. around the reaper arc i didn't quite enjoyed but this anime is very good. koro sensei is one the funniest teachers in anime ever in my opinion, the main character nagisa that people tease for being a girl because he's a boy with long hair is a funny running gag. the story is about a giant yellow octopus (koro sensei) blows up the moon and plans to destroy the earth in 1 yearand a low grade class have to try to kill him.\n

Have you ever heard of the Yellow Octopus monster who knows everything, can regenerate really quick and travel at 20 mac of speed? And did i mention he can also FLY!? Well there was a teacher who was like that.
Assassination classroom is one of those generic shounen anime that you've been watching over and over... or so you thought. One of the main thing you could notice, is the diversity of cast and the management of all the characters, not that many shounen anime could emphasise on almost all of the characters within the show, it usually is the main characters getting the most screentime while the side characters that were introduced in the first few episodes get cast aside, but that's not the case for assassination classroom.


What ruined a potentially perfect shounen anime is how the 'plot armor' revolves around the teacher, well sure, he's supposed to be almost invincible, but there are just so many nonsensical stuff going on that it's hard to say if the students could actually have a slight chance of even scratching him.


In the end, it's all about entertainment, what better way to spend your time than to watch an action-packed straightforward show?


Just don't try to use the techniques shown in the show, they're absolutely real...

Ansatsu Kyoushitsu (also known as Assassination Classroom) is an interesting and very enjoyable action/comedy anime. It follows a class of students that must kill their octopus-like teacher, Koro-Sensei, by the end of the year, or he will destroy the entire Earth. The show follows the class' adventures with their teacher, through assassination, school, and even field trips. By the end of the show, you'll be wondering if they should kill their teacher, even if he will destroy the world if they don't.
The story is extremely lighthearted and action-packed for most of the show (Although near the end it takes a dark turn). Although it isa story about students trying to kill their teacher that would destroy the Earth, it still manages to have a cheerful and carefree tone to it. The art itself is nothing amazing, but well suited to an action-comedy anime such as Ansatsu Kyoushitsu. Character development is simply amazing: Although the show focuses on an entire class, each classmate has their own in-depth backstory and personality, all which are learned as the show goes on. It was an all-around enjoyable show, something worth watching.\n\n
In conclusion, I'd definitely recommend watching Ansatsu Kyoushitsu. It perfectly fleshes out all the characters, and manages to have a lighthearted theme. The story is simple yet complicated, as if it were a series of delicate strings woven together.

lots of action and learning involved. the first episode gets straight to the point and every episode after that just gets even better. 
I highly recommend this anime.

Ansatsu Kyoushitsu - also known as Assassination Classroom is an anime that differs from your average anime where the genre school is tagged to it. In fact I may even refer to this as one of the rare masterpieces of storytelling that I came across on my journey through anime and manga. There is no particular condition which the viewer needs to fulfill first in order to enjoy this anime since it discusses so many different aspects of life sometimes in a smart and funny way while simultaneously being able to send the more serious messages which contain wisdom to the audience. 
To give anoverview about what is to be expected when you enter the lessons of Koro Sensei you better not have zoo-phobia or the like because you'll be astonished once the lesson starts. An octopus like creature is too much to handle for anyone who haven't seen too much science fiction lately. This being not enough our octopus is actually the main protagonist around whom everything revolves for the most part. Quite the strange setup you tell yourself - but you know what ? This exact situation where a monster is called the teacher leads into some very amusing events throughout the show. Furthermore the main goal of the students of 'class-e' is to kill their teacher so that they may prevent the earth from total destruction. 


Now the title 'Koro Sensei' already refers to the relationship these students of class-e have with their teacher whom they casually are able to call their sensei. On the surface it probably appears like there is some kind of oppression going on coming from that yellow smiling octopus but soon enough the viewer is able to understand that this distinctive smile is nothing but the true and pure outcome of a person as compassionate as this monster called Koro Sensei. To get a better grasp of who he really is one shouldn't forget about his moving speed that is said to be around mach 20 or 6860m/s. Meaning he's able to cover the distance from Germany to USA in about 20 minutes. 


Even though there is an overall plot the anime still could be considered episodic but that is based on your own opinion. The main point to consider however is that each episode focuses on one of the characters that are present which leads to a sufficient character development. If you enjoy comedy anime in general then you absolutely will be pleased while watching this especially when it comes to the face expressions of koro sensei which I enjoyed the most. On the other hand the plot doesn't only revolve around class-e but also involves other classes from the same school which are all together opposed to class-e because it's considered as a place where only the 'losers' end up and the mysterious chairman also has a hand in this while the government cooperates together with the children from class-e to achieve their main goal of killing Koro Sensei.  


I'll conclude this review by saying that I humbly would recommend this anime to anyone since there is something in this that everyone will find interesting regardless of his own taste. You will have a complete new understanding about the term 'assassination' afterwards and it's even possible to have a new way of understanding to life as a whole after watching this anime because for me it was a refreshing experience and the lighthearted moments combined together with the explanations of what really is important. I was overly certain about not having wasted my time much rather I got the impression that I've 'killed' my free time doing something quite entertaining.

Who wouldn't want to kill their teacher??

Story: I love the idea. The concept is humorous and I think the way class 1E or the "End Class" is portrayed is interesting(still annoying though how everyone else is all...y'know ill leave it at that for this part).

Overall: I recommend this to pretty much anyone who is ok with Koro-sensei's face(I mean some people might be scared of him-who knows;)) and likes action, comedy and school.

Assassination Classroom follows class 3-E as they attempt to assassinate their teacher, later nicknamed Koro-Sensei. The story is beautifully written with serious aspects thrown within the comedic adventure. The story allows younger viewers to enjoy the show while also giving more insight to those older viewers with background knowledge about certain jokes.
The design of the animation is incredibly smooth and it was very difficult to find anything flawed with it. Although most anime features bright colours and tones, during certain scenes, darker variations of colours create the effect the story wants to portray perfectly.
Since the anime features a large variation of characters, it's very difficultto get to know them all. Some are introduced very thoroughly, explaining their motives and reasoning in the plot, however most are excluded. Although the viewer may recognize a character for their previously stated backstory, the characters aren't worthy of having their names remembered.\n
The audio and sound produce through this anime keeps the viewer on edge. The right soundtrack adds to the emotion of each scene.\n
Assassination classroom is a beautiful story. The sound and art assist the  brilliancy. As a viewer who recently fished the second season, I completely recommend this Ansatsu Kyoushitsu.

Hello fellow Anime funs (pardon for my English later on)
I know for some of you note worth of "10" will be too high for this anime but for me myself I found it so good, so emotional, so well designed that I had to make a rating of a 10 out of 10 since I have no objections about anything from story to enjoyment.
