Well I love all kinds of anime and every one has it's own magical looks that's why I am putting here 10 out of 10.


Sound :

As far as I hate almost every intro and outro songs in Anime I can't tell the same about soundtrack inside of Ansatsu Kyoushitsu which is great. It's tensed where it should be and it's calm or even heart-moving in places where it should be. I have to admit there is some well designed music when someone reaches to the last episodes of 2nd season so you can google something on youtube to hear them out. They are outstanding.


Characters :

I won't be telling about everyone himself because It will took heck a long time to do. The class is a group who consists of poor and wealthy kids which their notes nor attitude where not that good as they should be that's why they have landed on the "E" class. Every character got his own back-story whether they had tough childhood by beeing borned in slums or beeing pushed way to hard by his parents and they ended in "worst" class "E".

They all for sure growing up since episode 1 till the very end of episode 24/25 (so far 24 episode is the last one) of season 2. Give them a try and you will see that those characters are designed very well.


Enjoyment :

I've told you I've watched whole anime in one day and I did not even make a single break. I think that tells everything about enjoyment 


Overall I could not say anything bad about it because it was pleasure for me to watch this and I have to say I do not watch the best once (in my opinion) twice. 10 out of 10 is way to low. I would give 100 out of 10 if I could. If you love anime as I do then just hop in and enjoy it and who knows maybe you will end it by crying in the last episode :).


Thanks to FUNimation Entertainment, Fuji TV, DAX Production, Dentsu, Lerche, for creating this masterpiece.

I watched this anime at a time when I wanted to watch something that was just mindless fun. The main question is, did this Anime deliver? 
Story: 7
The premise of this story is just plain ridiculous, which is one of the main reasons I chose to watch it. My initials thoughts were that the show would get old pretty quick, and that each episode would just be assassination attempt after assassination attempt all ending in failure. Thankfully the show was variant enough throughout, with unique assassination attempts, conflicts with rival classes, and other twists and obstacles, which I felt was enough that it did notget too stale at any given time. Being a more episodic series, the quality of the episodes range from good to mediocre throughout the series, without any sort of consistency. The last arc of this season I especially found bland and completely drawn out longer then necessary. Thankfully even the more bland episodes have some good to great comedy bits sprinkled in to make the experience a bit more enjoyable.



Characters: 7


Being about a classroom, the show has a rather big cast of characters to deal with, meaning some unfortunately would not get much time or development throughout the show. What's sad is that only a handful of the 20+ students are developed well enough with only a couple actually being memorable (Karma being the biggest standout). The teachers by contrast are handled very well, with Karasuma being a great straight man and Bitch Sensai being very decent comedy relief. The most important character to the show, Koro Sensei, provides very good comic relief, an interesting outlook on teaching and an mysterious background behind his motivations, which all work to make him the best character of the show (no real surprising there since the main selling point is him). The antagonists are mostly mediocre, with the Principal of the school being the clear standout for the best due to his ruthlessness and especially cold personality.



Sound and Animation: 6 & 7.5


None of the OP's really stood out to me, same with the music throughout the series, which is not to say that they were bad, just not that memorable. Wish I had more to say here about that, but I don't. The animation is good with decent character designs, especially Koro Sensei. The action is very well animated also, with very good gunplay and close quarters combat sequences, which I felt were very fluid and impactful, which I find some Animes have trouble with. 


Enjoyment and Overal Score: 7


The show had some good action and good comedy sprinkled throughout, enough to satisfy my fix for mindless fun, so it at the very least accomplished its goal. However, the shows lack of consistency, mostly weak villains and an underused big cast really hurt its score overall. If your looking to have a good time and wanna just turn off your brain and watch some over the top, humorous, straight up ridiculous anime, I'd say give this one a watch.

Before watching the anime, i had read one or two chapters of the manga and heard about the story from a friend. From those i thought i already had some idea about how it was going to be and i was increbly anxious to watch it. 
The story. I have to admit i was somewhat disappointed when i first watched it. From reading reviews and people commenting about it, i was sure it was supposed to be a pretty badass story. It did sound like THE story...on paper. 
On the animation, though, it was portrayed in a fairly silly way, the comedy and sarcasm overlappedthe scary action filled story. That’s my only complaint in this point, but notice that this “little” detail ended up ruining a big part of my experience. Regardless, I have to say the idea was an original and the application was quite good. Specially the slow-cooked relationship between teacher and students made it more enjoyable and relatable 


The art. I wasn’t used to this drawing style on the characters part. The thick lines were a bit of a problem for me, but that goes with taste. Although it did match with the teacher’s animation.


The characters. As mentioned on the story topic, I loved the slow development of the relationships in the classroom, as well as their own individual personality development. There was a good mix of different temperaments in the classroom. Also for the teacher, who was getting closer and closer to the kids, even though he was supposed to be the bad guy.


Enjoyment and overall. I had a fun time watching this, specially on the first and last episodes were the climax reached its highest point. It was nice seeing how the students got attached to sensei and vice versa, and how they were trying so hard to get away for him to live afterwards.

I haven't been watching anime for very long. I must be coming up to 5 months. In this short amount of time, I've been able to observe many different trends, formalities and gimmicks and one of those is School life. In around 50% of the anime that I have watched, the main protagonist has had to balance the interesting life with the less-so-interesting school life. Don't get me wrong, I understand why the writers do it. I understand why most characters are teenagers regardless of the context and I'm sure you do to. With that, I have never considered myself one for the 'slice oflife' genre. When I watched Toradora, I considered it 'dipping my toe in the pool' and although I liked it, along with Clannad, its not really something I'm hyped over.


You may be thinking to yourself - "Whats slice of life got to do with it? This is about a classroom of assassins trying to kill their superhuman teacher." - and while you may be right, there is more to it than that. Assassination Classroom is unique in the sense that it does what others have done before but with such harmony that it becomes greater than the sum of its inspirations.


When I write a review I try to match the tone of the anime I'm writing about, unless I have something extreme to say, with that said,

You can take of the scuba gear now, we won't be going any deeper.



Story -


Assassination Classroom (AC) is a story about a classroom of exiled delinquents who are charged with trying to kill the mutated M&M that decided he wanted to be a teacher in-between destroying the solar system. When I first read the synopsis I thought - This is gonna be one big gimmick-fest isn't it? - I was wrong. The teacher, who later becomes called Kuro-sensei has great chemistry with his class and as a result, we get a mix of 'slice of life', madness, comedy and all around positivity.


On top of this, the weapons that the class are given can only hurt Kuro-sensei, which may seem insignificant but it opens so many doors for utter chaos which pays off nicely.


One thing I will say is how easily everyone (including the government guys) forgot that their teacher was planning on destroying the earth. It seemed like the plot forgot itself and took a more developmental approach to everyone's relationships. This also resulted in school focus, which was OK if only because exams were portrayed in a gladiatorial sense where they were taking out the things from Evangelion which represented exam questions.


Art and Sound -


There isn't much to say to be honest. Art and Sound is only as good or bad as the story its for. Luckily for it, the story was amazing. I will say that the Art was on-point. The portrayal of Kuro-sensei was amusing and worked very well.

Sound wise, the sound track was pretty memorable, I may even put one or two on a playlist. They complimented the anime well... that's as much as I can give you.



Character - 


AS is officially the first anime to acknowledge my inability to determine whether or not a character is a boy. Top marks. -heh-


Anyway, one thing that I can flaw MAL for is its labeling of character roles. They are either mains or supporting. Don't let it fool you, everyone is a main. In this season, nearly everyone in the class is given equal time in the spotlight, nobody is the best at everything and all responsibilities are shared.


Independently, all characters are different... Really different. To go through them all would be torture to read so, I'll just tell you that they are each worth your time and are all memorable and unique.


Kuro-Sensei is a lot easier to talk about. His end goals completely contradict his personality and while it is kept to the side lines, he and the class form a tight bond. Kuro-Sensei is probably one of my favorite characters in anime, he is so smart yet so clueless. So evil yet so selfless. So cocky get so considerate. Its very hard to make a character everything but I don't think it could have been done any better in this case.



Enjoyment -


To say that I enjoyed this anime would be an understatement. I loved this show. The only thing I can really scrutinize it for was the fact that it forgot about the whole 'assassination' part of 'Assassination Classroom' for a little while.



Conclusion -


I loved this anime... Loved it, loved it, loved it. I imagine that the next season is going to be even better. Knowing that the second season wraps it all up, stories will be told, attempts will be made and bonds will be broken. I can only hope that it ends well (I write my reviews season by season so I'm gonna go find out... bye).

"Ansatsu Kyoushitsu" or better known as "Assassination Classroom" is one of the best shounen series in this decade. It starts with the quirky episode about killing an overpowered character then slowly takes the audience to the feels train wishing you to go back to school and relive those youthful days. Technicality wise, the animation, music, script, comedy, and action are topnotch. The show touched a sensitive part of the educator in me when I realized that a weird yellow octopus on a doctorate toga can make any teacher put to shame. Now, I think a new education development model can be formulated based on thisanime.\n\n
This is a show every otaku must watch. No Fillers and set on middle school since of high school which plagued shoujo dramas for ages. I give it a 10/10 rating.

[STORY]
The story for Assassination Classroom is so retarded its not even funny.
Basicly a class of highschoolers are recruited by the military to kill their teacher who happens to be a genetic experiment who wants to teach the class for a year before he destroys the world.
The problem with this is the teacher is virtually unkillable.
Now im sure you have some questions, dont worry you are not alone.
why does he want to be a teacher?
Why is he going to destroy the earth?
Why is the military hiring children?
we never get any answers this entire show.
along with no conlusion unless we get a new season.
so yea this showsstory is so half thought out i find it best to view this series as a comedy show and not a action series because thats what it really is.


There are certain times where it gets serious but most of the time its just comedic anime gags.



[ART]



The art style is pretty mediocre, nobody really looks unique at all aside from the teacher and it just seems very basic like they just used CTRL+V on generic characters for this show.


Theres nothing special artwise.



[SOUND]


The sound for this show is pretty basic its nothing really all that special the opening is kinda of generic, BGM is almost unnoticeable and the voice acting.......ok the voice acting is pretty good for a english dub.

Also having the voice of YesMan from Fallout New Vegas for the teacher was just fucking brilliant.


[CHARACTER]


so this show apparently attended Tite Kubo's school of character design because they have way too many characters in this show.

and aside from maybe 5 characters they are referenced but never get any clear screen time but it expects you to know all these characters by episode 2.


the characters it does focus on are great characters but there are just way too many to give this category a high score.



[ENJOYMENT]


based on my review so far you would think i hated this show but honestly i loved it.

Yes it has loads of problems that could have made it dead on arrival but its one of the funniest shows ive seen this year making it well worth viewing especially if you need a laugh.


It has a similar situation as panty & stocking did where it was pretty shit but its humor made up for almost all of its downfalls.


So yes i would certainly recommend this series to anyone who asks.

Ansatsu Kyoushitsu is REALLY great.
Story (10/10): The story is very unique. And I like the genre school life a lot. The creators have created a funny yet serious atmosphere in the anime, and I like how great it is.
Art (9/10): I like the art style a lot because it's really colourful and fun even though it's about a octopus teacher that's going to blow up the earth :D
Sound (10/10): Jun Fukuyama. It's all I have to say :D
Characters (9/10): There are a few main characters only, but all of the characters that we learn about have great backgrounds, and to me it's really important inan anime.\n
Enjoyment (10/10): I like the anime a lot. You should definitely watch it. If you have watched Baka to Test or GTO, you'll like this a lot.\n
Overall (10/10): Just watch it! It's awesome. I want a teacher like Koro-sensei, and you will too. :)

The series was rated "Very Good" on Anime News Network with 165 votes on 452.
Assassination classroom is an excellent anime which is really surprising. It could have been made very darkand bloody as Akame ga Kill or Danganronpa, but it's actually very funny and light. The plot is very interesting, because it's the first time I saw a school anime where the students had to kill their teacher and it's a very original concept which has been pretty well developped. What makes this series very amazing is the fact that it stays nice during the whole 24 episodes while most of the series have somedisappointing epiosdes or arcs. The characters are the best part of this anime, because we can follow the evolution of every member of the 3-E class. Each classmate has its own personnality, strengths and weaknesses and they are all very different one frome each other, which reflects the tremendous work of the autor Yusei Matsui. In addition, the antagonists, the teachers and the side characters are extremely complete and have an individual character to each. The soudtrack is good and the animation is excellent also. That'S why I rated it 9 on 10.

Ansatsu Kyoushitsu or Assassination Classroom, a peculiar name for an anime which proved to be equally peculiar and yet highly entertaining. Assassination classroom tells the story of a group of students who have the daunting task of killing their teacher who happens to be an octopus like creature who is powerful enough to destroy earth. 
                             Even if it sounds ridiculous, the anime is something which is great. The story progresses at a reasonably fast rate andyet doesn't lose even a minuscule ammount of the narrative elements a story should have. It is almost a vicious delight to watch Korosensei(the octopus like creature), dodge bullets and knives all the while teaching his class of students. Students who have been deemed unfit for regular schooling, students who possess extraordinary skills which make them perfect candidates for killing their teacher. The story is well written and holds both, action and life lessons. In almost every episode, we learn something new about a character, be it a student or Korosensei himself. The progression rate of the story is impressive, it does have a tense undertone, as there is a deadline for the students who want to kill korosensei, but, the story somehow throws the spotlight on how good of a teacher korosensei actually is. As far as characters go, korosensei is an enigmatic one and is supported by equally interesting charactes. Nagisa Shiota, who happens to be a lead character, perfectly fits the cap of an unlikely hero. The characters of Karma Akabane and Kaede Kayano are also well written. There is a huge amount of character development all throughout the series. Nagisa, a boy who is often tease for his androgynous appearance, quickly develops into a person who is the most talented at Assassination. Also intriguing are the characters of Karasuma, a government employee, and Irina Jelavic, an assassin, both of these people teach different things to the class while trying to kill korosensei themselves but by the time this season ends, it is evident that they have grown to respect and even admire korosensei as a teacher.\n
                                         Ansatsu Kyoushitsu is an anime which is both enjoyable and fun, along with being a story of growth and understanding. The series shows how each of the students grow also throwing great focus on the class working together to come up with ways to kill korosensei. The anime is higly enjoyable, portraying a lot of complex emotions in a simple manner. I highly reccommend this to any and every perso who has had an enigmatic and encouraging teacher in his or her life. Overall, it is truckloads of fun and doesn't feel boring even for a little amount of time.

"Assassination Classroom" is my favorite anime ever. However, that opinion may change as time goes on so if something replaces this as my favorite I will edit this and change that statement.
Story: While this premise is not very deep, it is unique and works well with this type of series which is a comedy and does allow for the ongoing mystery which is set up. since there are no rating things for a script, I will put my statement of it here. Some jokes fall flat but the majority at the very least got a chuckle. 9/10
Art: The character designs are unique and Korosensei's design,in particular, adds to the absurdity of the situation which helps in making it clear that this is a comedy. The background looks well made and the eyes of the characters look unique. Color choice also looks nice and the oversaturation shows that this is a comedy. The one flaw is that when characters are talking, it is mostly static with just lip flaps. However, that is most anime so it does not matter too much. 10/10\n
Sound: The voice actors do there job great even in the dub and the sound effects are good. The soundtrack sounds bland but when it wants to hit you in the feels, it really works. 9/10\n
Character: The entire cast is unique with there own personalities. the development of the characters makes sense and really makes you care about everyone in class 3-E. It was my favorite part of this entire show. they also work off of each other to make you laugh. My personal favorite character was Karma. His blood thirst and ego are hilarious and his character arc was really well done. 10/10\n
Enjoyment: I think it is the best anime ever. The way the characters work off of each other in comedic fashion made me laugh a lot and I could relate to some of the characters. It was just a fun time overall. 10/10\n
Overall: I would be lying if I said I wasn't biased but it is still a fun comedy with lots of character development. Overall. 10/10

Story
It repetitive and boring. I believe there are 2 seasons so near 50 episodes of trying to kill this guy. How much can you milk this show. It should have lasted 13 eps at most.
Art
Its there. Nothing great about it as there are no beautiful cuts. It's what I expect from a more recent anime release.

Each and every character bothers me. Maybe it's just me, but they are all annoying in they're own way. Also the alien guy is the most confusing character imaginable. He will destroya world, but first he has to teach??? Like how is this logical, I get there was a promise, but how can a promise lead you to teach kids and destroy the world they live in after.\n\n
Enjoyment\n
There was none from me \n\n
Overall\n
If you enjoy seeing how many ways they can think of failed ways to kill and alien by all means watch the show. I am sure most people watched since they want to know how he dies, if he does at all, but honestly I rather just google search it to see the creative way of his death, if there is one.

Assassination Classroom (AC) is a show about a class of F-grade misfits who are one day given the task of assassinating their new homeroom teacher. And if that’s not strange enough, their teacher, Koro-sensei, is actually a seemingly untouchable, tentacled creature who threatens to destroy Earth should they fail in their assassination.
But more than a high-octane thrill ride featuring elaborate assassination attempts and exciting fight scenes, AC is an unexpectedly touching show about growth. This particular group of young adults have been looked down on all of their lives, by their parents, peers, and teachers. They have repeatedly been told that they will not amount toanything just because their grades are mediocre. Who can’t relate to that on some level? Who hasn’t felt that crushing sense of shame when made to feel like a loser by the people you look up to most? I can certainly relate to that, having attended a grades-focused, well-to-do academy myself. Middling (though hard-working) B grade students like me were always overlooked in favour of the A+ students, who were showered with accolades, praise, and opportunities that I could only dream of. So the treatment of the E-class absolutely struck a chord with me and I expect it will you, too, should you identify with any of what I just wrote.


But under Koro-sensei’s tutelage these students were able to shine. He didn’t take a one-size-fits-all approach to education, but gave each student advice specifically tailored to them, taking into account their experiences, personalities, strengths, and weaknesses. And rather than cramming their heads with facts, Koro-sensei would attempt to engage his students as well as teach them useful life skills, such as conversations skills, the joy of reading, and not succumbing to peer pressure. And even when the students didn’t succeed, with their exams or their assassination attempts, he never branded them as being failures, but continued to encourage and support them. It was so uplifting to see the students grow in ability and confidence as the show progressed. It demonstrated just how much of a positive effect having somebody believe in and encourage you can have on your life.


But in addition to being touching, AC was hella funny. Because of Koro-sensei’s varied and astounding abilities, it had an anything goes vibe and often featured ridiculous and unlikely scenarios, such as using porn mags to lure Koro-sensei into a trap as part of an assassination attempt. AC was also pretty self-aware, often breaking the fourth wall for a laugh. In that way it felt a lot like another one of Jump’s babies, Gintama.


AC had a large cast, which included the 3-E class, their adversaries, their contemporaries, and their teachers. The standout characters were Koro-sensei, who I have already gushed about, and Nagisa. Nagisa was the character who exhibited the most growth throughout the show. It was satisfying to see him go from being the class punchbag to the one who everybody looked up to. But instead of letting this go to his head, Nagisa remained humble and was quietly confident and self-assured. He made a nice change from many other (Jump and otherwise) male protags, whose abilities make them arrogant, loud, and annoying.


However, AC didn’t really benefit from having so large a cast of characters, as most of the E-class were pretty forgettable. And there wasn’t a female character who especially stood out to me. Irina-sensei made a living off of her sex appeal, Kayano was obsessed with her flat chest, and Hara was mocked for being chubby. The women were little more than the total sum of their body parts, which was a shame.


AC was fairly good-looking and had catchy opening and ending themes. Its art style and sound design weren’t especially outstanding or unique, but they definitely get a passing grade.


In conclusion, AC was unexpectedly touching and a lot of fun. It had a few lovable and memorable characters and looked and sounded good. I’d recommend AC if you’re a fan of Gintama and/or Sakamoto desu ga? as both are equally silly and the latter also features a seemingly untouchable character who, despite the best schemes of those around him, excels in every situation.

Disclaimer at every review I am writting: don't mind my perfect english
'cause english is not ma mothertongue yall.
This review includes the second season as well, but the score I am giving here is the score I think it's fair for this season!
I think that this review would be refreshing for some people because we always need to read through an entire book when it comes to MAL reviews. But what most people are looking for is an opinion if they should watch or leaf the anime for good.
My review is spoilerfree. 
You find a discription and - even a trailer - of this anime, sodon't look forward to any discription of the plot here.\n\n

- you are an obsessed person who bashes on every anime ever\n
because he thinks that his objectivity is a bless to the entire anime world. This is not an anime for you.\n

Just look at that cute face, innocent smile, hairstyle..how.HOW.JUST HOW?? 
Can you make junior high students hold guns. Damn you author
Ok let’s get serious. When I started, it makes no damn sense. A few episodes in, still no dice.Watched till episode 7 just meh. Very episodic and story doesn’t even relate, you even got washout bulleys picking from behind and the cast is way too big gives off Negima-vibe (and you know how inferior anime is to the original manga) About all that is good is the non generic, even first of its kind teacher. I could be watching Death Note and HunterXHunter (’11 edition) or Kaze Koi which I’m currently holding off for this failed ass joke.\n
 But if you manage to sit through first seven eps, you’re in for some good nurunurunuru* The anime is 22 eps with one goal of students killing their teacher but to no avail. Why? A classroom filled with murderous little children whose teacher is an indestructible smiling octopus thing whose bent on destroying the world.  I had such high hopes for this anime with a synopsis like that.  But in the end, the show fell flat.
Ansatsu Kyoushitsu didn't break from common school themes that most anime follow.  There were all the typical students with their typical dramas and woes.  Then came the typical drama of falling in love with the enemy and internal conflicts that persist throughout the series.  The whole thing became very predictable.  There wasn't much substance to hold my interestbut I powered through to the end.  I know a show is good when it ends and I instantly feel that I'm going to miss the characters or need to find the prequel or even fan-fiction.  This was not the case for Ansatsu Kyoushitsu.  The only feels I had for this show was "meh."

At first I didn't want to watch Assassination Classroom because I thought it would be too goofy for my taste. However I got into an altercation with my economics professor in college and, I was pissed. After that I was in the mood for a high school anime and, this anime came up. I started watching and, I could not stop watching. Before I knew it I finished the show in about 10 hours which blew my mind. I decide to rewatch it and, it was just as good as I thought it was.
The story of Assassination Classroom follows class #-E the Outcasts of KunugigaokaMiddle School, the class is filled with delinquents and, students who weren't up to the standard of the school. Then one day the moon gets destroyed and, is in a crescent shape permanently. the creature that did this threatens to do the same with the earth but, first he asks to become the teacher of this class. The government agrees to pay the students if they can kill him. However the creature who looks like an octopus humanoid emoji hybrid turns out to be the best thing in their lives.


The story of this show was absolutely whack and, could have gone wrong in so many ways but, the execution was brilliant. The story was handled brilliantly, it was relatable because who didn't want to kill a high-school teacher at some point in their lives. Also, the creature who is given the name Koro-Sensei is the best teacher ever, I can only wish to have had a teacher like him when I was in high school. The story also executes the theme of the group that is outcast to perfection especially during a group assembly where our main char caters are treated like garbage. To add on to this the story isn't rushed and, is given time to progress and, develop. This approach allows for future plot points to be set up and, characters to develop. The school element of the anime was one of its best features and, the illustration of the pressure students are under was so surreal yet relatable especially the episodes where they were doing exams and, a baseball episode. This show also blends comedy and, drama better than any other anime I have ever seen. There are also two school trips which took place in the city and, on an island that gave some of the best television I've seen all year. I also loved how the show was self aware and, took risks that I haven't seen in other anime. 


I have never heard of Lerche studios therefore I had no idea what to expect from the animation aspect of the show. The visuals of the show were absolutely beautiful and I believe that this is the most vibrant anime that I have ever seen. The action sequences of the show were almost of cinematic quality particularly the final assassination attempt on Koro-Sensei this season, if you look up edge of your intensity this sequence would be there it was absolutely phenomenal. There is also a very dramatic fist fight between one of our main characters Nagisa Shiota against an ex military guy who is probably the biggest jackass in anime history. The only character that I hate more that that guy is Joffery from Game of Thrones but the way that fight was handled was brilliant. The character designs were absolutely beautiful. Each character having a distinguished look and, that separates them from any other anime I've ever seen.


The musical sore of the show was probably one of its best features as its instrumental themes were perfect. each enhancing the tone of the show in a horror, dramatic or comedic way. The first opening of the show was a head scratcher because the opening scene was intense, dark and creepy then transforms into an action film and then the goofiest opening ever but, it gets you pumped to watch an anime. The second opening was similar to the first fun, full of energy and hyper with bright colourful visuals that were beautiful to look at. The ending of the show hello shooting star was a mesmerising song as it was calm and, peaceful.


The show takes an interesting approach with its characters as it attempts to give each character in class 3E development. Our main character is Koro-Sensei as he essentially drives the plot of the anime, he is a great character in every single way, both funny, bad ass and, relatable. Our next main character is Nagisa Shiota a boy who looks like a girl, at the beginning is is like the punching bag of the class but he grows into the biggest badass in the class thanks to one of the coolest characters in the show. The only other character that feels like a main character is Karma Akabane who starts of as this psycho type students but across the series becomes more relatable and humane but retains his smart ass mentality. Other characters such as professor Bitch an mr Karasuma were cool and their interactions are fantastic. Ritsu an AI who gets an entire episode dedicated to her developing a likable personality, Terasaka who undergoes the largest development in the show and, every other student ranging from science geek to pervert to anything else under the sun but most importantly assassin. the main campus students treat our protagonists like shit and, this is a part of a messed up system created by the principal of the school. Seeing the struggle the students of 3E went through was reminiscent of the current world as some people are put down so others can succeed. To be perfectly honest I would have loved to be a part of this class, it would have been the ultimate adventure.


I enjoyed this show from start to finish. I loved the comedy and, drama. The characters and, story  were relatable and an absolute joy to watch. The music and action sequences were great and, this anime holds a special place in my heart as it gave me joy during a time of depression.

The premise is a fine idea, the super being about to destroy the world but wait he doesnt seem all that bad, interesting, but thats sort of where it ends with being interesting. Typical school setting with typical school characters. They didnt too much go out of the norm with this one. Your basic shonen. Had they like assembled a team of expert assassins from around the world for like a seminar where he wanted to tested the best this world has to offer and some how went into their back stories of how they became assassins and mercs that wouldve been interesting, but basicthrow kids in a classroom and create a zany plot that makes no sense...copy and paste anime

I have not yet finished this anime, but so far it's great and others tell me it is too. It provides a unique dark setting that's actually not gory or visibly disturbing (although some characters are likely uncomfortable with it). It also has minimal fanservice (but some at all which is actually visibly pleasing, especially going along well with the art style and occasionally seeming unexpected as a nice surprise for those who enjoy it) and a quirky cast, not to mention a fairly interesting twist on a "slice of life" situation. Overall, it's somehow very positive and peppy while being kinda dark, but thepositive outweighs the negative (considering it's fictional, of course) and so far, there's not a bittersweet feel to it (I haven't seen the ending yet, though).

I have completed Ansatsu Kyoushitsu also known as Assassination Classroom. This show is about a hyper fast hyper intelligent octopus looking superbeing who has destroyed a large portion of the moon. This upright, smiling, yellow looking monster then threatens to destroy the earth given a year's time. Since he is so fast, no government in the world is able to kill him. Now, this cheery cephalopod, after toying with the nations of the world, has some odd requests. He requests to teach a class of 9th grade kids who are the worst in their school. There as the monster, that the kids then named Koro-Sensei,teaches, the government assigns the kids to kill their teacher. The reward? 10 million yen. The kids then begin their assassin training to kill their teacher.\n
This concept seems weird at first, bunch of kids trying to kill a planet killing monster, but also being taught by said monster? Although, the execution is top notch and thats what matters. There are quite a bit of characters in this series, and its consistent with them too even though about 8 or 9 are really important. You can see them all from the beginning. Its one of those anime that despite having a large cast, they do it well as to make them not distracting. The character designs are simple and elegant, except for Koro-Sensei, and their personalities match to them. I especially like the teacher's personas the best. Koro-Sensei's character was very entertaining and carried the show for me. The cartoonish actions of his strange body and his easy-going, reliable personality made him a fan favorite. It makes me forget that the goal of the show was to kill him. I believe that the art is below average for the show unfortunately though. There are some very good parts where the animation really shines. The music is fine if anything, the OP's and ED's are terrible in my opinion. Despite it flaws, I still like this show a lot. I give Assassination Classroom, a 9 out of 10. With anyone who knows anime to watch it. This has been your spoiler free but not really review on Ansatsu Kyoushitsu aka Assassination Classroom.

First off, pretend that score doesn't exist. that's not my official rating. This is simply advice to anyone thinking of watching this show. It is not 100% action. It's mostly school-life with occasional action scenes. I personally do not like this anime, but I can understand why others might. If you like school-life and action you'll like it. I don't care that much for school-life. It is also really repetitive. It's less so in the second season, but if you can't stand repeating formulas of starting the school day, accepting a challenge from the A class or teacher, challenge begins, action scene, E class comesout in some way, show principle scheming another plan or berating his son, repeat, then don't even bother with this anime. And while it's not like this in every single episode, it happens way too often for my taste. Also some really fucking stupid twists occur in the second season. One in particular made me stop watching. Overall though, I can't fairly assess it, especially since I haven't finished, but this is simply a warning for people who wouldn't like this so they don't waste their fucking time waiting for themselves to start liking it.

This anime isn`t very serious, it`s mostly a comedy. The fights aren`t very good and any serious moment is pretty mediocre. But the first 10 episodes of this were actually prety good. The jokes were funny and it was pretty amusing. But as the season progressed I felt myself having to grind for the last episodes.
Story: 6
The story to this didn`t make much sense but it was alright. It worked for what they wantedto do with it. It was kind of ridiculous but the entire show was ridiculous so I guess it fits.
Art 7 and Sound 4: 
This is a newer anime so the animationlooks good in this, nothing ground breaking though. I judge sound on voice actors and the music. I hated the voice actor for the main character, it just didnt fit and was annoying.  Plus the intros were absolutely aweful, I like anime`s with nice intros but i couldn`t stand these.\n\n
Character:\n
The characters in this both ruin and make this anime. On one hand the teacher is awesome. He`s super funny and may even be one of my favorite characters. But on the other the main character is garbage. The voice actor didn`t fit for this character and it was a very generic character. But all of the supporting classmates were pretty good. Honestly any of the supporting characters would have made a better main character.\n\n
Overall: 5\n
Overall I would recommend you at least try this anime. The first ten episodes are actually pretty good and you`ll definitely get some good chuckles in. You may even like the whole anime. It just felt like it was missing something (like a good main character).

MASTRPIECE !!!
eat first the title looks similar to daganrompa but is totally different worth watching both season and extras 3 Times again and again, especially the characters.....
who would have thought that nagisa is a boy from the very beginning ???
we all weren't sure if he was even a boy.....
the plats are also mind teasing there are serious moments ,heartwarming and funny moments .
it perfectly describe life .through watching this I feel more conferrable with my surroundings , this not only my entertainment .....
but also a life lesson worth remembering a teachers love to he's fellow student is worth everything.....( dude the ending breaks me tosmithereens : ( )

When I first heard about Assassination Classroom, a close friend of mine said he watched. After that I searched it up and saw a yellow octopus and immediately thought that this was a dark and creepy series. Being a person who heavily enjoyed My Hero Academia this series was recommended to me. So I decided to give this anime a chance and after completing season 1 here's what I think.
Story:8/10
Intriguing and unpredictable. Like I said earlier I thought this series was gonna be dark and violent(hence the title's name)but it turns out I was wrong. This series focuses more on its lighthearted tone and aboutbeing fun, and in some cases it makes it better this way. Where it truly shines is when Koro-Sensei is teaching his students as he bonds well with them and being the best teacher they ever had. This leads to unpredictable moments as it makes you ask, "How will they kill someone that's not only unkillable but loveable." Where the story gets disappointing is actually its dark assassin side which is underwhelming cuz you would expect it to shine here.


Art:9/10

Colorful and great. The character designs were given effort here and what liked was how everyone was given their own unique look that helps us recognize them. The visuals are bright and full of rich coloring that adds to the series' light tone. A huge highlight here was how heavily detailed the setting's backgrounds were making them look realistic , examples would be the school's building and beaches. As far as animation goes there were times when it felt crisp and clear(The openings)but it also looked a lil too standard at times. The biggest standout here were Koro-Sensei's facial expressions which were heavily used for comic relief and worked to perfection.


Sound:8/10

Very good here. I was actually slightly disappointed in the music here, there's not a specific track that stood out to me. Usually most anime openings sound great to me but unfortunately that wasn't the case here. My favorite track would have to be the ending theme as it was very fitting and had a nice sound to it, but its not something that I would wanna listen to on my spare time. The dubbing was very solid, the star here is w/o Sonny Strait as Koro-Sensei. He nailed his comedic moments and you can tell that he has lots of fun in performing the role.


Character:7/10

Good job here for a good sized cast. In terms of entertainment this cast is top notched, they're all so fun, enjoyable, and rarely do they give you boring scenes. Koro-Sensei is honestly one of the most enjoyable characters in anime and to think an octopus like creature who's the villain that incredibly likeable sounds kinda weird. However him as character isn't great yet cuz we weren't given enough insight nor his motives to why he wants to blow up the Earth. There are some students that are given depth and insight such as Nagisa and Karma, but there are others that don't and it feels underwhelming. I found Itona and Shiro to be fascinating characters but they weren't given enough screen time to TRULY standout.


Final Verdict


Season 1 of Assassination Classroom was very good and enjoyable. I definitely get the My Hero Academia feel to it as its setting heavily centers inside the school. It comes across a lighthearted show that likes to make its audience laugh and have fun with. As for its flaws since its story isn't completed yet its next season can hopefully fix this. Its next season is also its last and I'm looking forward to how it concludes.

Assassination Classroom is a great anime, another anime in which I get to obsessively fangirl over Jun Fukuyama and his voice as he voices the lead Koro-Sensei. Breaking it down:
Story: The story was really good for this anime. It was the kind of story that we can all relate to in some way or the other and it was able to really resonate with me on a personal level, Koro-Sensei's quest to help better his students and get them out of the E-Class mindset. Unfortun ately there were parts that felt like the story was beginning to drag, and some of the episodes felt thesame, in the sense of attempt assassination, fail, life lesson, rinse and repeat. This only happened in the first part of the anime, whilst they were revealing characters, and it was a good way to do it, so an 8/10 for story.


Art: I think that the art was quite well done in this series. It had awesome fight scenes that were well-choreographed, as well as smooth animation throughout its entirety, as opposed to some that are great only in, or every time besides the action scenes. 8/10 for art.


Sound: I think that the OST was quite good for this season of the anime, and the ED was good as well. I greatly disliked the choice of OPs though, so I'm only giving it an 8/10.


Character: I think the characters in this anime are very in-depth and fleshed out really well. There are few continuity issues with characters' personalities and this anime has spawned some of my favourite characters in anime. The exploration of backstory was done quite well, and it did not feel forced or out of place. The voice-acting was also quite welldone. 9/10 for characters.


Enjoyment: As I have previously stated, I really enjoyed a lot of the things about this series, and of course Jun Fukuyama is the lead! It doesn't get much better than that, along with everything else I listed, so this definitely deserves a 9/10 for my enjoyment.


Overall: Taking everything into account, and ruling out my incessant fangirling, I still believe that this anime deserves a 9/10, probably an 8.5/10 to be more accurate, but I'll round it up since this anime is really enjoyable and I got quite attached to the 3D characters and background soundtracks, I highly recommend this anime.

I don´t know how I have not seen this anime before.
Well built characters, comedy and action abound in this anime where the goal is to kill your teacher. I found the original issue of killing your teacher so you do not destroy the land and reward you with millions of yen.
This anime is a great example of the great education that Japan has since teachers there care about the future of their students. At present, I think education has fallen a lot. In my first year of FP I have witnessed the misconduct that some teachers have with students, not empathic and that there aremore professional and competent people who deserve the position more than them. I myself lived as an English teacher called us fools, the class to pellets and even our tutor had to talk to her to solve the discrepancies we had with the teacher (which did not work).


I think the teachers should see this anime to better understand the students because, Koro-sensei helps them, gives them advice and lessons wise and cares for them. Koro-sensei is the perfect teacher, the ideal teacher that every student should have.


As the series progresses, students evolve, face their fears and decisions which will not be easy. And the series, never bores you.


The action scenes are very good, at all times you want to know what is that mystery that surrounds Koro-sensei, who he is and why he wants to destroy the earth. His story is tragic and that ending, THAT FINAL ... I cried.


The only fault I've seen is that very few comedy scenes have made me laugh and some characters have had more prominence than others. Even so, the anime is fun and very entertaining.


Undoubtedly, this is an anime that everyone should see.


Note: 8


Have you seen the anime? What did you think?

I felt like this show was created to appeal to junior high kids in the Congo. It tries to make killing and school look fun. It teaches cliche life lessons that you would see on a PBS kids show. their was even a point were the MC says "just be yourself" and even shows a kid saying no to drugs. If you are a child you might enjoy this show as it makes assassins look "cool". But when they compare tests to monsters that can only be slain by studying and working hard and "doing your best" I felt like I was watching an educationalvideo. This show has a serious setting but ignores all the serious aspects. these children don't seem to understand the situation they are in. and if they did they would HATE their teacher as he is threatening to kill them and their family's. All they care about are their grades and wanting to be liked. its almost as if they don't know what assassins do or know what killing or death is. If they were to kill their teacher they would be filled with regret since they are so attached to him. Not to mention that these CHILDREN are being taught that killing is OK. what is this the Congo? Sorry I know I already used that joke. these children are gonna serial killers in a few years.

Look, I don't write huge reviews. I like to keep things concise to give the utmost  simple opinion. Here is my two cents on: Assassination Classroom Season 1!
The story is simple, an odd yellow octopus thing that can move at MACH 20 blows up 75% of the moon, and vows to do the same to the Earth next March. No government or agency can touch him, they have given up. Oh, and he wants to teach the lowest class, E-Class students at a middle school. The students have to work with assassins to learn and then kill him by the end of the schoolyear, March. 


The art is clean, action sequences look good.


The sound is spot on, and the voice acting is quite superb.


The characters have some depth, but this is a mostly lighthearted anime.


The enjoyment however is where this shines. Assassination classroom is simply fun to watch. You will be addicted to the almost childish nature of Kuro-Sensei, and the kids are equally fun to watch, especially when you can relate.


RATING: WATCH THIS ANIME FOR SURE

I was recommended Assassination Classroom after asking people for anime similar to Naruto's Chuunin Exam arc. The arc where taking a difficult written exam becomes really big drama-fueled mind games and students use creative methods to cheat on it, I've always felt that was a really underrated part of the show.
I feel Assassination Classroom is largely only similar to that on paper. This is mostly a comedy and while there is some test-driven drama, it's not very common, so I don't feel it was an accurate recommendation.
However, it wasn't a completely terrible show. Though I found the comedy hit-and-miss, there were moments where I laughed,as well as a few other moments I enjoyed. There were a couple particularly likable characters as well.\n\n
For me personally, though, the laughs weren't frequent enough and the plot too thin for me to score this very high. Despite its bizarre concept it's a pretty mediocre anime and left me feeling neither here nor there, which can be categorized as a waste of time.

This is one of the few anime I give 10/10 across the entire board. Art and sound was AMAZING. Simply the art has me engrossed in this Assassin/pre-apocalyptic anime. Next is the story. I found the story original and compelling. It also brought up several issues that caused me to think about my own life as well as the fate of the world as a whole. Another thing I liked about the story is how it doesn't just jump in and gives you everything, but slowly introduces new facts and shows hoe the students have to deal with it. Which leads me into my nexttopic, character (development). This anime has some of the best character development I've seen in a while touching everything from Self value, parental expectations, hard work, social life, and even classification and separation. I loved watched each individual student grow as they faced challenges in both their every day school and home lives, but also in their "secret mission". I would recommend this anime to ANYONE who loves action anime, school life anime, or anime that can be related to. I myself was able to relate to a part of each individual students challenges

What I like about it:
+ That interesting idea in which the target of assassination teaches the killers to kill him. Yep. He even encourages them, and find all their hidden strength in each person and take it all out in the best way. Awesome.
+ The ending song. It works so well. I'm glad they didn't change it for 22 episodes.
+ This show will give you interesting lines and teach you how to navigate yourself and make your talent shine at its best while still being yourself. (some are kind of "you don't say", though)
+ You will never forget this iconic yellow octopus teacher, ever.
What Idon't like about it:\n
- Have you ever find a scenario in movie where you feel like there's no way it will work unless the author want it to work? Something like an escape route that feel forced to exist, or a plan which obviously more risky but they ended up succeeding for no real reason. Yeah, you will find it here too, quite often.\n
- That outrageous school system is approved? Well, let's just assume all the parents, society and government in this world is just made of paper who will only say and act just to bring background story under the author's intention. Should be more interesting if the society is opposing this school.\n
- Occasional exaggerated metaphor. Oh, I can't spoil anything here. But really, sometimes the metaphors are just 'meh'. I'm not even sure if it's for comedy or serious thing. \n
- Another disappointing detail: That half-destroyed moon. Isn't that going to make changes to earth in one way or another? No? So apparently, it's just for show. A waste of idea.\n\n
What I feel indifferent about:\n
- Art is okayish.\n
- Plot is nothing exceptional.\n\n
Overall:\n
It's pretty fun to watch. The story is mediocre, nothing stands out. What's really interesting is the relationship between the teacher and his students, and of course, his teachings. Nice waste of time.

This review applies for both seasons of the show.
Assassination Classroom is a good choice if you're looking for a comedy that is hopelessly optimistic, while you're also holding interest for a school setting that actually manages to portray a classroom properly. However, it is a bad choice for you if you dislike its style of comedy, and if you think that you would dislike a series that tries to have serious moments while resetting all possible negative consequences right afterwards.
The series aspires to be both a comedy and a show about the care and affection a teacher has for his class and the affection theclass has in return for its teacher. By making them kill him and holding the planet as ransom if they don't comply. I love you, kids. However, due to the fact that it tries to be a comedy that can make you laugh at any time while also trying to have a lesson to draw at the conclusion of each arc it created sort of a predictable format for each of its arcs. Even worse, due to its premise inciting in a direction that has to feature some sort of action somehow, in order to portray action and stay true to the premise, occasionally the series has to go to a really dark place or an unseen twist and fix it immediately after in order for it to stay a cheerful comedy. 


As a result of all of this, this is the structure of almost every arc in this anime: Create a dangerous situation OR a heavy malicious twist from a character or characters that were meant to be on the class' side. Solve the situations while strengthening the class-teacher bond, while displaying the teacher in a strong light. Then turn every character from evil to neutral or neutral to good after the entire conflict or arc is over, except for like two characters which feel like edgy saturday morning cartoon villains. And then hit with the conclusion from which the class or the persons in the conflict draw some conclusion, always optimistic.


This is kind of my biggest gripe with the series. That it tries too hard to maintain things in the same status quo through and through, and only positive consequences are accepted in the aftermath of each arc. For a shorter series it would've been fine, especially if it took itself less seriously than Assassination Classroom, but when the structure's format becomes so prevalent, this does take away a lot from it. Because look, none of their actions have any negative consequences and things are too positive, hence a lot of the drive of the action is just removed whenever it is about to happen. And this makes the series predictable, which in turn kills my involvement and some of the comedy, since a lot of it is character driven. The characters start to feel more like means to tell gags than actual portrayals of people and... this makes the show feel very artificial after one point for me.


I'm not saying it's always consistently in this structure or having this effect constantly. It occasionally breaks out of this structure just for some more comedic episodes and each arc has some varying levels of success, where the action and how it is solved makes sense while the lesson hits the right spot. But a lot of the time, the inbalance between the negative consequences and positive consequences takes a lot from its meaning and my investment in it. 


If it weren't for the structure and the unsatisfyingly tame conclusions to some conflicts, this series could've been a lot better, because it does do a lot of things right. 


The story of the anime focuses on displaying the bond between a teacher and its students, someone who puts genuine heart into helping his pupils improve. Despite the fact that they have to kill him, he's the most helpful person they've had in their life in regards to their academic studies. The story is not very complex in regards to what it does. As I've said the series has a structure, it pretty much follows that structure all up to its end. it will try to develop the relationship of the students and deliver a lesson each arc and mini-arc. Don't expect something any more complex than that.


The comedy is mostly character driven and it plays it off of all the characters contextually, taking advantage of the multitude of characters to create some feasable non-intrusive jokes. I mean, the occasional "oh wow the teacher is a pervert" or "girls without clothes, am I right guys?" doesn't bode with me because of the frequency of these jokes, but otherwise, the series does amuse me most of the time. It built its comedic bits well and I do applaud it for that. Most of its humor is contextual, and most of the jokes are jokes told by characters at the expense of other characters. Which is something to be expected in a classroom dynamic. The sense of humor is mostly contextual, based on character interactions. Depending on who is the butt of the joke, you might be amused by it, you might be not. It all depends on the context.


I appreciate how the class was built, each character having one or two traits to distinguish them in personality or appearance. Not all of them are particularly memorable and charming, some of them have enough traits just to be able to be distinguished, and some of them have more development and focus put on them. While this must not sound particularly good, since every character gets some moment or other and they all have some degree of screentime, it was enough to flesh out a functional classroom, where you understand the groups and subgroups of the class and you understand which characters of the class are the popular kids of the class and which are the unpopular more ordinary kids. You understand the hierarchy of the class, who has which place in the class and who they are. It's natural to have more focus on certain characters that contribute more to the class while letting the less involved abstain. Think back to your time in school and the class you've been part of. I'm sure you can remember a bunch of things about the kids that got the spotlight of the class and only one or two traits about the kids that didn't get much of it. It's the same thing here. While they don't all get constant attention, they all feel like they have a place in the class they're a part of.


The action of the series was surprisingly decent. There are some fights that involved some degree of planning, with a couple of possibly expected twists because assassination requires the element of surprise, but that played exactly into what would be generally expected. However there were a couple of moments where the fights didn't go an obvious route in their execution, and the best example is the inner conflict of the class. You see for the most part the class is complaisant with each other, not having too much of a conflicting mindset about their actions with one another, but there is this one episode where they will. This creates two sides in the class who decided to solve the conflict by fighting each other in a capture the flag paintball match as a mock assassination competition. When the fight reached its peak something interesting did happen. Rather than fight in a manner of winning or losing the fight, the characters decided to fight in a way that would prove their point to the other person. It was a really high point in the series and a genuinely nice action piece to observe. Usually, the action is just decent, occasionally strategic, usually banking on an element of surprise, even possibly to the extent of an asspull, but that's to be expected given the class' goal of eliminating its teacher and the length of the series.


The artstyle of the series is usually solid, but it has these weird moments when everything is way too bright. Like, the characters look like they're under such a bright light, if they look directly into it they would at least be temporarily blinded. The general color balance is fine otherwise, it just has some weird moments when this is the case. It doesn't really work out considering the overall design of the series is very bright colored already. I don't have any complaints in the sound department, or any immediate compliments. I didn't particularly enjoy any of the openings or endings, but there were a few songs I've enjoyed off the OST.


So, if you're interested in Assassination Classroom, accept it as a very optimistic comedy that always aspires to be meaningful. Don't expect the story to not be without its share of tragedies and sad moments, but know that by the end of each day, the series will stay as optimistic as it can. If you're not looking for a comedy, the school setting turns you off or the attitude and structure of the series sounds like a big gripe, I don't advice watching this series. It is a show that tries to not take itself seriously when telling a joke, just in time for it to get serious in order to lecture you. But I'd like to note something. Not once did I really talk about how the show has created a tentacle monster that is going to destroy the world. Because this creature was portrayed as a teacher that wants to help its students. That is its most prominent role and nothing else. If you think that a gigantic yellow emoticon with tentacles being so easy for someone to be accepted as just a teacher is competent or incompetent for a series, you might want to reconsider watching or not watching this series.

I did not finish this show, but I can't imagine much changes as it moves forward.
Assassination Classroom is a series that tries to do a whole lot. If a series like this wishes to have a strong connection with its audience, it must succeed at most of what it does, because any individual thing that it succeeds in happens so sparsely that it cannot carry the rest of the series alone. AssClass just sort of drops the ball on execution. While the series has solid presentation and is generally funny, it is also clogged up with junk that doesn't mean a whole lot to theaudience. 


[Story]

The basic premise itself is great! This alien guy blows up the moon, and threatens to blow up the earth in one year's time. He is so fast that he can't be killed, but makes a deal with the government to work as a teacher for a certain class so that he can be supervised and a secret to society. This class is a group of misfit toys, the bottom of the barrel in their school. But Korosensei (the alien) happens to be a great teacher who strives to really help the kids succeed. Both in academics, and in trying to kill him. There are many themes available to touch on, and the show does take advantage of this. There is...


- The action of the assassination attempts.

- Learning background and helping individual members of the class.

- The class' role and adversity as a section of the whole school.

- The backstory of Korosensei.

- The humor of the characters and situation at large.


However, these mostly start to fall flat. For instance, the assassination attempts lack agency because there is never any consequence. Korosensei is both invincible and does not enforce consequences on his attackers. The individual characters are very flat, not much beyond pure tropes. A large component of the series is just doing character studies where Korosensei helps the students be more comfortable with themselves, but the characters are weak enough that the audience does not really care. The school has a morbid, inaccurate portrayal of morality in a class-based-system, which makes the adversity of class 3E feel totally fabricated. Korosensei's backstory seems compelling but is really only teased at. The humor in the show is decent, but at the same time it is mostly the same gag -- Korosensei is fast and can do random things in the blink of an eye.  


So really, though a bunch is happening, it devolved into something like a student/assassin-of-the-week show, with no end, growth, or substance in sight. Many things could be done to fix this, and it isn't to the point where I believe AssClass S2 couldn't be saved, but it isn't worth continuing for me.




[Art & Sound]

The presentation in the series is good and hardly ever flubs. It has an interesting style of drawing characters, where their outlines make them seem like stickers... but in a good way. There is really nothing bad to say about the art, but I guess there is nothing amazing about it either. Sound design is standard but good.




[Character]

Korosensei is the lead, and really the only character. He is entertaining, and potentially has a compelling backstory that will be revealed in an organic way. That's great. But every other character so far is just straight out of Tropesville and very bland. Just look at the 'main character', Nagisa. I've never seen so much of a blatant self-insert. This character literally does nothing. Beyond that, Nagisa's look is neither typical male nor typical female, allowing her to work as a surrogate for a wider fraction of the potential audience. Come on, why do you need this in the show. This is just one character, but is really an example for what the show tries to do. It just shotguns these weak woe-is-me characters at the audience, and hopes that a few of them can stick the landing. Do better, anime.



[Enjoyment]

The series is generally funny, by virtue of Korosensei and him alone. But this is sort of offset by the rest of the junk going on that isn't really possible for the audience to connect with.



[Rating]

Story: 3

Art: 8

Sound: 7

Character: 2

Enjoyment: 5

Overall: 5

Ansatsu Kyoushitsu piqued my interest when included in top anime list at MAL. After watching 19 episodes, I can gladly say that I didn't enjoy them and decided to drop as a whole. This is because the reasoning behind the plot that was just too ridiculous for me. Of course, I am aware that it is a fictional plot and refreshing for the audience. However, looking at how junior high school kids able to surpassed their adult counterparts with the help of omnipotent Sensei remain ludicrous for me . Perhaps, the anime didn't suit my interest but I believe that people looking for a refreshinganime with a new concept can opt to watch few episodes and decide for themselves whether to continue or not.

Todo el mundo sabe lo que es pertenecer a la peor clase académicamente, sufrimiento, burlas por malas notas, expulsion, pero en Ansatsu Kyoushitsu no todo irá mal para la clase, puesto que vendrá un profesor muy peculiar a sacar de la tumba a la clase del final 3°E.
Por eso aquí tienen una reseña del anime Assasination Classroom.
Para empezar con este anime, debemos saber que tiene 2 temporadas, hoy vamos a analizar la primera por los siguientes puntos.
Historia
Personajes
Arte
Banda Sonora
Y al final haré un total de todos los puntos.
Perdónenme si me dejó llevar por mi subjetividad, pero está es mi primera reseña, así que si me equivocoen algo, diganmelo.

Dicho esto, comenzamos.


Historia.

La Tierra se ve amenazada por un poderoso monstruo que destruyó el 70% de la Luna con su poder, dejándola permanentemente en forma de cuarto creciente. El monstruo afirma que dentro de un año, la Tierra también será destruida por él, pero ofrece a la humanidad una oportunidad para evitar ese destino. Éste mismo comienza a trabajar como maestro en la clase 3-E de la secundaria Kunugigaoka, cuyos estudiantes tienen el objetivo de asesinarlo. 


La historia se ve ridícula y algo que sólo lo pensaría un niño de 5 años, ¿cómo un profesor que destruyó la luna y que dice que destruirá la tierra va a dar clase a unos adolescentes gandules que deben asesinarlo? No tiene sentido, pero al menos a diferencia de Katekyo Hitman Reborn, está trama ridícula no se deja llevar por ser ridícula y trata de dar sentido a la trama, ¿Qué como le da sentido? Eso lo verás por tu cuenta al ver el anime, si te lo digo, te spoileo.

Si hay algo que puedo darle reconocimiento a este anime es la comedia, la cual es muy divertida y agradable, no llega a ser tan graciosa como la de Gintama, pero tampoco es mala comedia, gracias a los cambios de humor de Koro Sensei, y a personajes como Okajima o Terasaka, esto se hara mas divertido para que lo veas.

Historia: 6


Personajes


Aquí mejora la cosa, per hay un problema, TOO MUCH CHARACTERS, la serie se centra en las aventuras de 26 personajes + Koro Sensei + Karasuma + Irina + Ritsu + Otro personaje que decirlo es spoiler. 

El problema de esto es que al darle tanto protagonismo a personajes como Nagisa o Karma, deja olvidados a otros como Okano o Isogai, y eso es un problema grande, si la clase E sólo fueran 10 alumnos + Koro Sensei + Karasuma + Irina, seria mejor elenco y equilibraria más las cosas, aunque al menos la serie se las arregla para desarrollar a tantos personajes, y con algunos lo hace bien, como con Karma, pero con otros como Nakamura deja mucho que desear

Personajes: 6

PD: La única chica de la serie que me atrae un poco es la chca cientifica que no me acuerdo del nombre ahora.


Arte

Aquí si vemos algo bueno, ya que el arte y la animación se ven muy bien, el estudio de animación, el cual, son los mismos que animaron Danganronpa, hacen un buen trabajo en cuanto al dibujado y el visual, los paisajes se ven bien, no son tan deleite visual como en Attack on Titan, pero tampoco llega al mediocre.

En la animación, en los primeros capítulos llegó a ver animación un poco rígida y estática, pero es en pocos capítulos, así que no me preocupa.


Arte: 7


Banda Sonora

La banda sonora es muy buena, la serie sabe cuando meter su música, en los momentos cómicos tenemos música divertida, en los momentos relajados, música más relajada, momentos de suspenso, música de suspenso, etc.., la serie sabe eso, y gracias a la banda sonora y al humor de la serie, podrás disfrutar la serie muy bien.

En cuanto a los openings son buenos, son cantados por los Seiyus de los personajes creando la banda 3 nen E gumi Utatan, que canta los openings, los cuales pegan con la serie y su letra tiene que ver con lo que pasa. 

Y los endings, el ending es mediocre y olvidable.


Banda Sonora: 7


Ahora debemos sumar todas las calificaciones puestas en cada apartado.

Recuerden que lo escrito vale más que lo visual, así que si me dicen: "Está mal ezcrita, pero Utatan hace los Opening, ez que note Haz vizto el anime, PLEB" pues se joden, por lo que he dicho.


Visual: 3/4

Escritura: 3/6


Nota final: 6/10

Una serie decente para pasar un rato divertido.

Y si me dicen: "La zegunda temporada ezta mejor, no zabez nada de Ansatsu Kyoushitsu, HDP" olviden eso, porque no tome en cuenta la segunda temporada, la T2 la reseñare en otro momento.


Hasta aquí está reseña.
